definition: (classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
having given away a bride, to lose one's army on top of it (idiom)/to suffer a double loss after trying to trick the enemy
pinyin: pei2 le5 fu1 ren2 you4 zhe2 bing1

definition: (old) dowager/old lady (title for the mother of a noble or an official)
Maria Skłodowska-Curie or Marie Curie (1867-1934), Nobel laureate in both physics (1903) and chemistry (1911)
see 居禮夫人|居礼夫人[Ju1 li3 Fu1 ren5]
Mrs Thatcher/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
the EU Sakharov Human Rights Prize
pinyin: Sa4 ha3 luo2 fu1 Ren2 quan2 jiang3

definition: the EU Sakharov prize for human rights
pinyin: sa4 ha3 nuo4 fu1 ren2 quan2 jiang3

sentences.english: John has a windfall . It surprises his wife greatly .
sentences.chinese: 約翰意外獲得一筆財富，使他夫人大喫一驚。

sentences.english: All the female cats wanted to be the cat"s wife."
sentences.chinese: 所有母貓都想做他的夫人。

sentences.english: Madame Defarge was one of the leading spirits of the Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 迪法熱夫人是這場革命的主要人物之一。

sentences.english: In Nigeria's press, Cecilia Ibru is referred to as the First Lady of Banking.
sentences.chinese: 在尼日利亞新聞界，伊布魯被稱爲銀行界第一夫人。

sentences.english: Madame Xian Tai was the chief of the Baiyue ethnic group in the Lingnan region.
sentences.chinese: 冼夫人是嶺南百越族的一位首領。
哈蒙德夫人問，“爲什麼謝我？”

sentences.english: One day Mrs. Slaton gave the class an assignment.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，斯萊頓夫人給全班同學佈置了一項作業。

sentences.english: Mrs. Black spent all her money betting on horses.
sentences.chinese: 布萊克夫人把她所有的錢都花在了賭馬上。

sentences.english: Mrs. Archer and her group felt a certain timidity concerning these persons.
sentences.chinese: 對這班人阿切爾夫人和她那個小圈子懷有某種畏怯感。

sentences.english: "No, lady, "came the reply. "You stick it on the envelope ! "
sentences.chinese: “不，夫人，”郵務員回答說，“要貼在信封上。”

sentences.english: Mr. Smith was succeeded by Mrs. Jones as treasurer.
sentences.chinese: 瓊斯夫人繼史密斯先生任會計。

sentences.english: Mrs. Castle was invariably standing there on the porch waiting for her son.
sentences.chinese: 卡斯爾夫人總是站在門廊上等兒子。

sentences.english: As she drove home, Mrs. Cox thought about the class she had just left.
sentences.chinese: 科克斯夫人在驅車回家的路上想着她剛上完的這節課。

sentences.english: It was my good fortune to be linked with Madame Curie through twenty years of sublime and unclouded friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我幸運地同居裏夫人有20年崇高而真摯的友誼。

sentences.english: Rosa Parks, was arrested for not giving a white bus rider her seat, Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 帕克斯夫人是由於未給一名白人乘車者讓座而被捕。

sentences.english: Conroy, dropping her money into the box.
sentences.chinese: 康羅伊夫人把錢丟進票箱時問。

definition: father's elder brother/term of respect for older man/CL:個|个[ge4]
older male cousin via female line
son of an official/son of nobility/your son (honorific)
